channel.title: math.CA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Uniformly rectifiable metric spaces satisfy the weak constant density condition
item.description: arXiv:2403.14479v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The weak constant density condition is a quantitative regularity property originally investigated by David and Semmes in their foundational work on uniform rectifiability. Roughly speaking, a space satisfies this condition if in most balls, the space supports a measure with nearly constant density in a neighborhood of scales and locations. In this paper, we prove that uniformly rectifiable metric spaces satisfy the weak constant density condition, extending a theorem of David and Semmes. In order to do this, we first prove a slightly modified version of a separate theorem of David and Semmes which weakly controls the oscillation of the means of $L^2$ functions.
item.dc:creator: Jared Krandel

item.title: Global Existence and Mass Decay Analysis of solutions to the discrete Redner-Ben-Avraham-Kahng coagulation model
item.description: arXiv:2307.08868v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The Redner-Ben-Avraham-Kahng (RBK) coagulation model provide a fundamental framework for modeling the aggregation of particles in various physical and biological systems. In this paper, we investigate the global existence of solutions to the discrete version of RBK coagulation equations, encompassing a wide range of coagulation kernels. Furthermore, we demonstrate that the mass decays with time and will eventually reach to zero even if the original mass is not finite. A small size particle is produced in the RBK coagulation model when two large particles collide with a slight size difference. Dealing with the role played by large size particles in the creation of small size particles was the major challenge of this research.
item.dc:creator: Pratibha Verma

item.title: Lerch $\Phi$ asymptotics
item.description: arXiv:2311.11886v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We use a Mellin-Barnes integral representation for the Lerch transcendent $\Phi(z,s,a)$ to obtain large $z$ asymptotic approximations. The simplest divergent asymptotic approximation terminates in the case that $s$ is an integer. For non-integer $s$ the asymptotic approximations consists of the sum of two series. The first one is in powers of $(\ln z)^{-1}$ and the second one is in powers of $z^{-1}$. Although the second series converges, it is completely hidden in the divergent tail of the first series. We use resummation and optimal truncation to make the second series visible.
item.dc:creator: Adri B. Olde Daalhuis

item.title: The Boundary Condition for Some Isomonodromy Equations
item.description: arXiv:2402.07269v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this article, we study a special class of Jimbo-Miwa-Mori-Sato isomonodromy equations, which can be seen as a higher-dimensional generalization of Painlev\'e VI. We first construct its convergent $n\times n$ matrix series solutions satisfying certain boundary condition. We then use the Riemann-Hilbert approach to prove that the resulting solutions are almost all the solutions. Along the way, we find a shrinking phenomenon of the eigenvalues of the submatrices of the generic matrix solutions in the long time behaviour.
item.dc:creator: Qian Tang, Xiaomeng Xu

item.title: The two-phase problem for harmonic measure in VMO and the chord-arc condition
item.description: arXiv:2209.14346v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $\Omega^+\subset\mathbb R^{n+1}$ be a bounded $\delta$-Reifenberg flat domain, with $\delta>0$ small enough, possibly with locally infinite surface measure. Assume also that $\Omega^-= \mathbb R^{n+1}\setminus \overline{\Omega^+}$ is an NTA domain as well and denote by $\omega^+$ and $\omega^-$ the respective harmonic measures of $\Omega^+$ and $\Omega^-$ with poles $p^\pm\in\Omega^\pm$. In this paper we show that the condition that $\log\dfrac{d\omega^-}{d\omega^+} \in VMO(\omega^+)$ is equivalent to $\Omega^+$ being a chord-arc domain with inner normal belonging to $VMO(H^n|_{\partial\Omega^+})$.
item.dc:creator: Xavier Tolsa, Tatiana Toro
